lexUnit.name: shawl.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a piece of fabric worn by women over the shoulders or head or wrapped round a baby.

sentence.text: He smelt smoke in her hair , felt her flesh soft under her shawl , and then a further quake in the crowd parted them .
Mina and Kāli covered their hair with their oldest shawls and , struggling together , slopping the contents , they carried the heavy pans into the house .
After about half an hour a girl came out of the gate , her tartan shawl held round her with rough , reddened hands .
Salt was making a meal of Jess 's shortcomings and Nancy stared at the new kitchen wench while her mother nodded in her easy-going way as she took off her shawl and recaptured her dropping hairpins .
Pooley eyed his colleague and the blue-faced Irishman shrugged in his blanket shawl .
Owing to the permanent rigid curvature of the celluloid limbs swaddling was not possible , so the doll was swathed in someone 's pretty Christening shawl .
The first thing Morag picked up was an old , lace shawl .
` Oh , she 's exquisite , " Ruth breathed ecstatically , looking down at the little dark-haired mite swaddled in a delicate white lace shawl , ` absolutely lovely . "
Maud took out the pillow , untucked the counterpane , folded away three fine woollen blankets and a crocheted shawl , and then lifted out one feather mattress and another , and a straw palliasse .
A group of chattering women in torn dresses and faded shawls entered the shop and Hari moved quickly towards the door , she must not hamper Ben when he should be working .
Some are elderly , some are pregnant and many are carrying babies in striped , woven shawls on their backs , toddlers trailing behind them .
He was occupied with sketching whatever came into view ; a mother with a baby that was draped in a purple shawl , lean cows of a delicate brown , meagre birches , scourged oaks , poplars .
Ruth was draped in the blue and green shawl , leaving her legs , her snow-white shoulders bare .
She draped a plain white shawl round her shoulders , and walked slowly to the farm .
She has some kind of black shawl over her shoulders .
She pulled on her shawl and moved quickly to the door .
My baby was wrapped in a beautifully crocheted pink woollen shawl .
Her figure was ungainly in the late stages of pregnancy but she wrapped her red wool shawl well round and kept her hands clasped in front so that it was not so noticeable .
Lying inside , wrapped in a clean woollen shawl , was the smallest baby I had ever seen .
To my surprise , instead of the scornful narrow-eyed blonde , I found two frail but good-hearted old ladies in charge , plaid shawls about their shoulders .
She followed him through the drawing room and into the bedroom where Mrs Browning , a thick shawl round her shoulders , sat up in bed .
The square is full of islanders , the men in trilbies or baseball caps , the women with embroidered black shawls round their shoulders or over their heads .
The silk shawl she draped over her shoulders winter and summer was in place ; her mother of pearl brooch was at her neck as it should be and her shoes were shining as immaculately as ever .
She would be down there on the terrace , in her black flannel coat and skirt , clutching her plaid shawl round her shoulders , her skirt hem clogged with snow …
The cashmere shawl had n't been expensive .
As a finishing touch , an antique embroidered shawl has been draped over a table to provide the perfect setting for a classic marble bust .
He took them through the cavernous littered kitchen , where an old woman in a grey shawl was mixing something in a basin on the table , and down the dark passage to the studio .
He pointed to a large plaid shawl which Mrs Robinson had used to decorate and disguise the back of a char .
She felt cold , although the central heating had been on all morning , and took a large brown woollen shawl out of a drawer and wrapped it round her as she sat in the beanbag and listened .
